t: Psalm 25
A Psalm of David.
Unto*p thee, O Lord,*s do I lift up my soul.
O*p my God, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine enemies triumph over me.
Yea,*p let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be ashamed which transgress without cause.
Shew*p me thy ways, O Lord;*s teach me thy paths.
Lead*p me in thy truth, and teach me: for thou art the God of my salvation; on thee do I wait all the day.
Remember,*p O Lord,*s thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindnesses; for they have been ever of old.
Remember*p not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions: according to thy mercy remember thou me for thy goodness' sake, O Lord.*s
Good*p and upright is the Lord:*s therefore will he teach sinners in the way.
The*p meek will he guide in judgment: and the meek will he teach his way.
All*p the paths of the Lord*s are mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.
For*p thy name's sake, O Lord,*s pardon mine iniquity; for it is great.
What*p man is he that feareth the Lord?*s him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.
His*p soul shall dwell at ease; and his seed shall inherit the earth.
The*p secret of the Lord*s is with them that fear him; and he will shew them his covenant.
Mine*p eyes are ever toward the Lord;*s for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.
Turn*p thee unto me, and have mercy upon me; for I am desolate and afflicted.
The*p troubles of my heart are enlarged: O bring thou me out of my distresses.
Look*p upon mine affliction and my pain; and forgive all my sins.
Consider*p mine enemies; for they are many; and they hate me with cruel hatred.
O*p keep my soul, and deliver me: let me not be ashamed; for I put my trust in thee.
Let*p integrity and uprightness preserve me; for I wait on thee.
Redeem*p Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.
